meaningMnemonic: 世界 means "world" and 恐慌 means "panic" or "scare," so when you put them together you get a scare that made the entire world panic. This is how we refer to <vocabulary>The Great Depression</vocabulary>. It was caused by and subsequently resulted in everybody in the whole world panicking together about money.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You've learned them already, so you should be able to read this on your own!
